name: Llangennith
description: The most consistent surf spot on Gower. 3-mile beach works on all tides with multiple peaks. North end rockier and more powerful; middle section best for learners. Gets busy but enough peaks for everyone.

name: Rhossili Bay
description: Spectacular setting beneath Rhossili Down. Same swell as Llangennith but often less crowded. The walk in puts off casual visitors. Strong rips when big.

name: Langland Bay
description: Sheltered bay that works in smaller swells. Popular with longboarders and SUPs. Gets crowded but friendly vibe. Reef at west end gives better shape.

name: Caswell Bay
description: Small sheltered bay ideal for beginners. Works best on smaller swells. Almost disappears at high tide. Rock pools good for kids when flat.

name: Oxwich Bay
description: Needs a massive swell to wrap into the bay. When it works, it offers long, peeling waves perfect for longboarding. Great shelter from westerly storms.

name: Port Eynon
description: Quieter alternative to Llangennith. Works on similar swells but more sheltered. Good for improvers wanting less crowd.

name: Broughton Bay
description: North Gower spot facing NW. Catches different swells to the main beaches. Can be excellent but fickle. Strong currents due to estuary proximity.

name: Three Peaks
description: A defined sandbank section of Llangennith beach offering punchier waves. A bit of a walk from the car park filters out the absolute beginners.

name: Crab Island
description: Heavy right hand reef break off Langland point. Only works at low tide. Hollow, fast and unforgiving. Locals only spot - respect is essential.

name: Horton
description: Connected to Port Eynon but often quieter. Good banks can form here. Easy parking and access. Great for families.

name: The Slade
description: Reef break near Oxwich that works on high tide. Can offer a long left hand wall. Tricky access and rocky bottom.

name: Pwll Du
description: Remote pebbly bay accessible only by foot. Picks up swell well and offers a unique setting. Rivermouth can shape good banks.
